title: Argentina’s grain harvest suffers under worst drought in 60 years
description: Already struggling under spiralling inflation, the South American country faces a decline in grain, its main export.

title: Railway CEO apologises for toxic train crash at US Senate hearing
description: Norfolk Southern chief says he is 'terribly sorry' but stops short of fully backing Senate bill to boost safety rules.

title: Six killed as Russian missile barrage slams into Ukrainian cities
description: Russia fires dozens of missiles targeting residential buildings and critical infrastructure across Ukraine.

title: GOP Senate leader Mitch McConnell hospitalised after fall
description: A spokesperson said that the Senate Republican leader is under observation after suffering from a concussion.

title: Trump’s ex-lawyer Ellis censured over 2020 election fraud claims
description: Jenna Ellis admits she made 'misrepresentations' related to the vote, which Trump and allies falsely said was 'stolen'.

title: Meta to review moderation of Arabic word ‘shaheed’
description: The word, which translates as 'martyr', accounts for more content removals on its platforms than any other word.

title: ‘War scene’: MSF temporarily shutters hospital in Haiti’s capital
description: Doctors Without Borders says patients and staff at Cite Soleil hospital at risk as violence rages between armed groups.

title: Israeli emergency services say three injured in Tel Aviv shooting
description: Israeli police said the assailant has been 'neutralised' after he opened fire near a café on Dizengoff Street.

title: Biden sets up for an election fight with his budget proposal
description: Biden's proposal will face stiff opposition in Congress and has 'little-to-no shot' at becoming law, experts say.

title: Is the war in Ukraine at a stalemate?
description: Russia launched a barrage of new air strikes on Thursday morning.

title: Lebanon government failing to uphold ‘right to electricity’: HRW
description: Human Rights Watch says Lebanon's electricity crisis has exacerbated poverty and inequality.

title: Global freedom recession may be ‘bottoming out’: Freedom House
description: US-based group says despite overall global decline for 17th year in 2022, net improvement may be on the horizon.

title: California braces for more flooding as another winter storm nears
description: Governor Gavin Newsom declares state of emergency in several counties as US state prepares for heavy rainfall.

title: Mexico’s president slams calls for US military to target cartels
description: Lopez Obrador denounces Republican-led push for US military intervention after fatal drug cartel abduction of Americans.

title: Russia takes east Bakhmut as Ukraine builds up forces
description: Analysts say Ukraine is bleeding Russia of men and ammunition in eastern city as it prepares to counterstrike elsewhere.

title: Moldova separatists say Ukrainian plot against leader foiled
description: The government in Chișinău says it is investigating the alleged incident as Kyiv cites a Russian provocation.

title: Ram Chandra Paudel elected Nepal’s third president amid crisis
description: Nepali Congress leader Ram Chandra Paudel elected third president since the country was declared a republic in 2008.

title: The battle to save Nepal’s wildlife
description: Tigers and rhinos were almost poached to extinction in Nepal - now their numbers are on the rise.

title: Nigeria’s election was a positive for the region
description: However imperfect, Nigeria's democratic and peaceful election was a breath of fresh air in a region crippled by coups.

title: Fourteen people drown when Italy-bound boat sinks off Tunisia
description: People from sub-Saharan African countries die off Tunisian coast after rise in racist incidents against Black Africans.

title: Bangladesh stun world champions England for first time in T20
description: Bangladesh beat England by six wickets to record their first-ever T20 win over the world champions.

title: Breaking news: How the war impacts Ukraine’s independent media
description: Independent news has been transformed but is also facing a crisis in Ukraine, say reporters, as the invasion continues.

title: Middle East round-up: Turkey’s opposition makes presidential pick
description: Here's a round-up of Al Jazeera's Middle East coverage this week.

title: Neil deGrasse Tyson on truth, disinformation and propaganda
description: 'We evolved to say to ourselves well, if we hear something often, it must be true … And this is the soul of propaganda.'

title: North Korea fires ballistic missile towards sea, South Korea says
description: The missile was fired at about 6:20pm (09:20 GMT) from near the North Korean city of Nampo, officials said.

title: The Accordion Wars: Famo music and gang violence in Lesotho
description: How musical rivalry in Lesotho gave birth to gang violence.

title: US defence secretary in Israel as protests target Netanyahu
description: Lloyd Austin lands in Tel Aviv as protests swelled at Israel's main airport over controversial government reforms.

title: Nigeria election commission delays polls for governors by a week
description: INEC says it needs more time to reconfigure BVAS machines at the centre of last month's disputed presidential vote.

title: UN nuclear chief raises alarm over Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhia plant
description: For the sixth time since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began, Europe's largest nuclear plant knocked off grid.

title: At least 36 killed in eastern DR Congo attack
description: Attack targeted the village of Mukondi, south of the city of Beni, in violence-wracked North Kivu province.

title: ‘Courage and audacity’: Young voices steer change at UN meeting
description: From climate change to digital inclusion, young delegates make their opinions heard at Least Developed Countries summit.

title: After earthquakes, Syrians utilise new rules to cross from Turkey
description: Thousands of Syrians have decided to rely on support networks in their home country.

title: How has work changed in the post-pandemic world?
description: Three years after the pandemic shut down the world’s economy, have relations between workers and employers shifted?

title: S Korea appeals ruling to compensate Vietnam War massacre victim
description: Court had ruled that Nguyen Thi Thanh be compensated for injuries sustained during a mass killing by S Korean soldiers.

title: Taliban governor of Afghanistan’s Balkh province killed in blast
description: Mohammad Dawood Muzammil's killing comes a day after he met top government officials visiting from capital Kabul.

title: Indonesian football officials jailed over deadly stadium crush
description: Two officials have been jailed after being found guilty of negligence in case of 135 killed in 2022 stadium crush.

title: ‘The money for my medical care goes to buy food’
description: How one Bosnian man and his family got through a tragic accident, the COVID pandemic and inflation.

title: The G20 could help fix Sri Lanka’s debt crisis. Will it step up?
description: The G20 includes Sri Lanka's top lenders and powers with influence. It must do more than just say sweet nothings.

title: Georgia withdraws ‘foreign agents’ bill after days of protests
description: An EU delegation welcomed the decision to drop the controversial law and encouraged Georgia to resume pro-EU reforms.

title: India’s Modi hosts Australia PM at stadium named after him
description: Anthony Albanese and Narendra Modi inaugurate cricket match between their teams at a stadium named after the Indian PM.

title: US fearful of pause in Syria aid delivery after airport attack
description: The airport in Aleppo was being used to deliver aid to victims of last month's earthquake that killed thousands.

title: Israeli special forces kill 3 Palestinians in Jenin shootout
description: Three men killed in what local media described as a shootout, while a 14-year-old died after he was shot on Tuesday.

title: Europe experienced second-warmest winter on record
description: Europe was hit by a severe winter heatwave in late December and early January, bringing record-high temperatures.

title: Nepal MPs vote for new president amid political uncertainty
description: Poll has fuelled feuds among main political parties, with a key left party quitting fragile ruling coalition last month.

title: Are Black people welcome in Tunisia?
description: Statements about sub-Saharan migrants and refugees in Tunisia have sparked backlash and protests.

title: Malaysia ex-PM Muhyiddin Yassin set to be charged for corruption
description: Politician questioned over funds allegedly channelled from building contractors to his party in exchange for projects.

title: Saudi engineer released from Guantanamo prison camp after 21 yrs
description: Never charged with a crime, Ghassan Al Sharbi, 48, returns to Saudi Arabia after being held for 21 years at Guantanamo.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 379
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 379th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Russia fires barrage of missiles on Ukraine cities, officials say
description: Missile attacks hit energy facility in Odesa and 'objects of critical infrastructure' in Kharkiv, governors say.

title: ‘No to the Russian law’: Georgians protest ‘foreign agents’ bill
description: Police use water cannons and tear gas as thousands gather in Tbilisi in protest against a proposed foreign agents law.

title: Australia to buy as many as five nuclear subs from United States
description: Submarines are part of the AUKUS pact with the UK, which may also jointly develop a vessel with Australia.

title: Biden to propose 25 percent minimum tax on US billionaires
description: US president's reported budget plan would also nearly double capital gains tax on investments.

title: Youth found in abandoned truck trailer returned to Guatemala
description: Authorities say the 106 children, many teen boys, were travelling without family in search of a better life in the US.

title: US issues warrant for $25m aeroplane owned by Russian oil giant
description: US government alleges the Boeing-made plane violated sanctions and commerce law by travelling to and from Russia.

title: UN condemns arbitrary detention of Iranian refugee in Australia
description: UN says Australia, which has detained Ahwaz asylum seeker Mr A since 2017, is breaching international law.
